hive.util package¶

Submodules¶

hive.util.exception module¶

exception hive.util.exception.StateTransitionError(msg)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

calls out a breach in the simulation’s physics observed when a state transition’s invariants are not met.

exception hive.util.exception.StateOfChargeError(soc)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

state of charge must exist in the range [0, 1]

exception hive.util.exception.RouteStepError(msg)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

errors related to stepping forward along a route

Bases: Exception

Bases: Exception

errors related to units

exception hive.util.exception.EntityError(msg)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

errors related to methods on entities such as vehicles or stations.

class hive.util.helpers.H3Ops[source]¶

Bases: object

Entity = ~Entity¶
EntityId = ~EntityId¶
classmethod nearest_entity(geoid, entities, entity_locations, is_valid=<function H3Ops.<lambda>>, k=0, max_distance_km=<Quantity(1, 'kilometer')>)[source]¶

returns the closest entity to the given geoid. In the case of a tie, the first entity encountered is returned. :type max_distance_km: km :param max_distance_km: :type is_valid: Callable :param is_valid: :type entities: Dict[EntityId, Entity] :param entities: :type k: int :param k: :type geoid: GeoId :param geoid: :type entity_locations: Dict[GeoId, Tuple[EntityId, …]] :param entity_locations: :rtype: Optional[Entity] :return:

classmethod nearest_entity_point_to_point(geoid, entities, entity_locations, is_valid=<function H3Ops.<lambda>>)[source]¶
Return type

Optional[Entity]

classmethod great_circle_distance(a, b)[source]¶

computes the distance between two geoids :type a: str :param a: one geoid :type b: str :param b: another geoid :rtype: Unit :return: the haversine distance between the two GeoIds

classmethod point_along_link(property_link, available_time)[source]¶

finds the GeoId which is some percentage between two GeoIds along a line :type property_link: PropertyLink :param property_link: the link we are finding a mid point along :type available_time: h :param available_time: the amount of time to traverse :rtype: GeoId :return: a GeoId along the Link

classmethod add_to_location_dict(xs, obj_geoid, obj_id)[source]¶

updates Dicts that track the geoid of entities performs a shallow copy and update, treating Dict as an immutable hash table :type xs: Dict[str, Tuple[V, …]] :param xs: :type obj_geoid: str :param obj_geoid: :type obj_id: str :param obj_id: :rtype: Dict[str, Tuple[V, …]] :return:

classmethod remove_from_location_dict(xs, obj_geoid, obj_id)[source]¶

updates Dicts that track the geoid of entities performs a shallow copy and update, treating Dict as an immutable hash table when a geoid has no ids after a remove, it deletes that geoid, to prevent geoid Dict memory leaks :type xs: Dict[str, Tuple[V, …]] :param xs: :type obj_geoid: str :param obj_geoid: :type obj_id: str :param obj_id: :rtype: Dict[str, Tuple[V, …]] :return:

hive.util.pattern module¶

hive.util.pattern.vehicle_regex = '^([\\w]+),(\\d+\\.?\\d*),(\\d+\\.?\\d*),(\\w+),(\\w+),(\\d+\\.?\\d*),(\\d+\\.?\\d*)$'¶

recognizes csv rows from a file with the following header: 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 id,lat,lon,powertrain,energycurve,energy_capacity,initial_soc
